member.name: M:VTS.Backend.Api.Controllers.AuthorizationController.GetTokenAsync(VTS.Backend.Infrastructure.AuthServer.Models.LoginModel)
member.summary: Request a JWT token of a user from Identity Server
member.remarks:
IdentityServer must be up and running. User must be registered in IdentityServer.
Use below credentials for trial (currently setup in IdentityServer):
Username: user1, Password: userpassword1
Username: user2, Password: userpassword2
Username: admin1, Password: adminpassword1
member.param: Username of registered user in IdentityServer
Password of registered user in IdentityServer

member.name: M:VTS.Backend.Api.Controllers.VehicleTrackerController.RegisterVehicleAsync(VTS.Backend.Core.Application.Features.Vehicle.Command.RegisterVehicle.RegisterVehicleCommand)
member.remarks:
A unique serial number (alphanumeric) must be supplied in request body.
Every vehicle will be associated with an authenticated user or admin (from IdentityServer).
Id of the authenticated user or admin will be retrieved from JWT bearer token.
To request a JWT token, hit api/authorization/token endpoint from Authorization section above.
Once you received the token, copy the access_token and place it in Authorize button in Swagger

member.name: M:VTS.Backend.Api.Controllers.VehicleTrackerController.GetCurrentPositionAsync(VTS.Backend.Core.Application.Features.VehiclePosition.Query.GetCurrentPosition.GetCurrentPositionQuery)
member.summary: Retrieve the current position of a vehicle
member.remarks:
Retrieves last recorded position in database for a registered vehicle.

Admin role will be retrieved from JWT bearer token.

member.summary: Retrieve the positions of a vehicle
member.remarks:
Retrieve the positions of a vehicle during a certain time, in order to display their journey on a map (maps drawing is out of scope).
